A Generic Function for Generating Formatted Field Strings

Source: R/data-ingestion_int.R
dot-di_fields_generic_get.Rd

This internal function filters rows in a data.table, calculates spacing for alignment, applies a glue template to generate field strings, and finally collapses them into a single character string.

Usage

.di_fields_generic_get(
  transformations,
  filter_col,
  alignment_col,
  glue_template
)

Arguments

transformations

A data.table (or similar) containing the fields for transformations. Must include at least the columns referenced by filter_col and alignment_col.

filter_col

A string specifying the column used to filter out empty rows.

alignment_col

A string specifying the column used to calculate spacing for alignment.

glue_template

A string template passed to glue_data, referencing columns in transformations. For example, "'{FLDNM_IN}' : '{FIELDTP}',".

Value

A single character string with the formatted field definitions.

Details

  1. Filters out rows where filter_col is empty ("").

  2. Calculates spacing based on the maximum length of alignment_col.

  3. Applies glue_data to each row using glue_template.

  4. Collapses the results into a single newline-delimited string, removing the trailing character (often a comma).
